record.field: Future Leader (Star)
These employees are always performing well. They are big picture thinkers, and problem solvers.

Offer these employees develoment opportunities and the ability to move into senior roles. Ask these employees what their personal development goals are and create a strategy for them to meet these goals.
Growth Employee
These employees are good performers and can easily go to the next level.
Consider assigning these employees more challenging tasks, or transfer them to another role that will stretch them.
High Impact Performer
These employees are great at their current job, but they have reached their maximum potential, and are limited by their skillset and mindset. They have no desire to expand their expertise.
Identify areas for coaching and development. These employees may require help on improving strategic thinking.
Trusted Proffesional
These employees are great at their current job, but they have reached their maximum potential, and are limited by their skillset and mindset. They have no desire to expand their expertise.
Consider these employees for mid-level management and develop communications with them.
Enigma
These employees could achieve great things but they are experiencing problems. These employees will demonstrate a strong willingness to change and adapt to address their weaknesses.
Invest in additional coaching and training.
Core Employee
These employees could be given more responsibility but will need training to help them succeed.

Motivate, engage and reward These employees may be considered for job enlargement at the same level. Assign these employees tasks and projects that will challenge and invigorate them. Note that these employees may need coaching in certain areas.
Effective Employee
These employees are good performers but they may have reached their career potential. They may be unsure about their career path.
Coach employees on becoming more innovative, and focus on lateral thinking.
Dilemma
These employees need develoment and coaching to progress.
Invest in coaching or training, or move these employees to roles that are better suited to their skillset. Focus on goals that will stretch these employees.
Under Performer
These employees are not performing well and are bad hires. Roles need to be reassigned the employees need to be demoted or their contract terminated.
Invest in training and coaching or reassign these employees to alternative roles or consider role termination.
